summary: The University of Pennsylvania (Penn) is a private Ivy League university in Philadelphia, founded by Benjamin Franklin before the U.S. Declaration of Independence. It's among the oldest colleges in the U.S. and has a rich history, with notable alumni including Founding Fathers, U.S. Presidents, Nobel laureates, and more. Penn has four undergraduate schools and 12 graduate schools, including the first business school and medical school in North America. Its main campus is in West Philadelphia, known for landmarks like Houston Hall and Franklin Field. Penn is very wealthy and spends a lot on research. Its athletics program, the Penn Quakers, competes in many sports.
title: University of Pennsylvania
